Hi Bernd,
You can use the TransclusionDecideRule (http://crawler.archive.or=
g/apidocs/org/archive/crawler/deciderules/TransclusionDecideRule.html) and =
set the max-trans-hops and max-speculative-hops to 0. This should stop the =
crawler from harvesting images, frames, scripts, etc. that are not otherwis=
e in your specified scope.

Lauren
UNT Libraries, Digital Projects

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com<mailto:archive-crawler%40yahoo=
groups.com>, Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...> wrote:
>
> swschilke wrote:
> > Dear =
All,
> >
> > Heritrix: I was reading the manual and I have a little problem=

> > understanding how I can set up a crawl job. My task would be to archiv=
e
> > only certain pages in a crawl job, i.e., I want to give Heritrix a li=
st of URLs referring to one page each and I want them to be collected (incl=
uding all components of that page (e.g., PDF files, images, ...). Anybody h=
ere which could give me a hint / sample job definition?
> >
> > Thank you v=
ery much in advance
>
> Roughy, this can be achieved by:
>
> - using the bu=
ndled default configuration
>
> - including all your URLs of interest as 's=
eeds'
>
> - setting the 'maxHops' value of the TooManyHopsDecideRule to '0'=
,
> meaning "don't follow links more than 0 hops from seeds"
>
> The follow=
ing TransclusionDecideRule will still rule-in items that are
> obviously re=
quired to inline-render the page (such as
> FRAME/IMG/STYLE/SCRIPT SRC link=
s) or even possibly-required (in the case
> of URL-looking strings in certa=
in form elements and scripts).
>
> So, the overall effect is: get exactly t=
he URLs provided as seeds, plus
> those things definitely necessary to rend=
er them.
>
> Note: "A HREF" links, whether to resources on the same site or=
 different
> sites, won't be ruled-in. (They'll all be considered '1' hop o=
ut, more
> than '0' hops.) So if you have a page full of links to PDF files=
 or
> photos or whatever, those links won't be followed.
>
> Some options t=
o consider if you want to get those:
>
> - increase the 'maxHops' to 1 -- t=
his will at least follow links into
> the same sites/site-prefixes implied =
by the seeds
>
> - add an extra MatchesRegexPatternDecideRule, late in the =
scope, to
> ACCEPT all URLs with certain desired patterns (such as ending "=
.pdf")
>
> Hope this helps,
>
> - Gordon @ IA
